intro: Phacelia demissa var. demissa, commonly known as blue phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and dry environments, often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Phacelia demissa var. demissa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in native plant gardens.
